title: 110_hr7277
content: The Act titled "Temporary IRA Distribution Suspension Act of 2008" suspends the required beginning date for distributions from defined contribution plans. The "Temporary IRA Distribution Suspension Act of 2008" suspends the application of section 401(a)(9) of the Internal Revenue Code for defined contribution plans during the period from January 1, 2008, to December 31, 2009. The calendar year for distributions is extended to the later of the year specified in the Code or calendar year 2010, and the suspension period is not counted towards any time limitations. During the suspension period under the Temporary IRA Distribution Suspension Act of 2008, certain sections of the Internal Revenue Code apply to defined contribution plans and eligible deferred compensation plans. Failure to make a payment from a qualified retirement plan during this period will not be treated as a modification for tax purposes. During the suspension period under the Temporary IRA Distribution Suspension Act of 2008, certain sections of the Internal Revenue Code apply to defined contribution plans and eligible deferred compensation plans. Plan amendments must be made in accordance with the terms of the plan during the specified period. Amendments made pursuant to regulations issued by the Secretary of the Treasury must be completed by the deadline specified. During the suspension period, plan amendments must be made in accordance with the terms of the plan. The amendment must be operated as if it were in effect during the specified period and apply retroactively. During the suspension period, plan amendments must be made in accordance with the terms of the plan and apply retroactively. This section of the Act will take effect on the date of its enactment, allowing individuals to recontribute distributions received from certain plans before that date. During the suspension period, plan amendments must be made in accordance with the terms of the plan and apply retroactively. This section of the Act will take effect on the date of its enactment, allowing individuals to recontribute distributions received from certain plans before that date. The taxpayer shall be treated as having received payments or distributions in an eligible rollover distribution and transferred the amount to an eligible retirement plan. The taxpayer is treated as having received payments or distributions in an eligible rollover distribution and transferred the amount to an eligible retirement plan within 60 days. Repayments for distributions from IRAs are treated as direct trustee to trustee transfers within the specified timeframe.
